title: Highway and road signs
content:
hi. Am new to this forum, so perhaps am posting my questions in the wrong place.   
   
I'm looking for highway road signs, specifically "fallling rock" graphics or "falling ice". The old falling rock in Colorado seems to be replaced by just words. I found one at Mesa Verde, but its not what I'm looking for.   
   
I glimpsed a great one in a friends slide from New Zealand.
author: kcm2

comments.content:
I think you're looking for [Interstate Pi.](http://web.archive.org/web/20051109095516/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/interstate-pi/)   
   
But they don't seem to have the specific sign for Falling Rock. Maybe you can create it from one of these...

Here's a few   
 [official UK](http://web.archive.org/web/20051109095516/http:/www.hmso.gov.uk/si/si2002/02311326.gif)   
 [official Finland](http://web.archive.org/web/20051109095516/http:/www.tiehallinto.fi/liikennemerkit/varoitusmerkit2.htm#top)   
 [non official Germany](http://web.archive.org/web/20051109095516/http:/www.sicherestrassen.de/VKZKatalog/index.htm?http://www.sicherestrassen.de/VKZKatalog/Kat131.htm)   
 [official Norway](http://web.archive.org/web/20051109095516/http:/www.vegvesen.no/vegskilt/fareskilt/index.stm)   
 [official Sweden](http://web.archive.org/web/20051109095516/http:/www.vv.se/vag_traf/vagmarken/varningsmarken2.htm#1_1_13_1)   
 [official Switzerland](http://web.archive.org/web/20051109095516/http:/www.astra.admin.ch/media/verkehrssignale/signale_index.gif)   
 [official Korea](http://web.archive.org/web/20051109095516/http:/english.kangnam.seoul.kr/residency/trans/sign1.htm)   
 [general road sign links 1](http://web.archive.org/web/20051109095516/http:/www.intlsigns.com/world/traffic/)   
 [general road sign links 2](http://web.archive.org/web/20051109095516/http:/homepages.cwi.nl/~dik/english/traffic/)
There's a whole heap of international photos [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20051109095516/http:/www.elve.net/rrot02.htm)
